name: Front Cable Pull (Narrow Grip)
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the cables at chest height and set wider than your shoulders.
2. Hold a bar attached to the lower pulley with a narrow grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.
3. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, lean forward from the hips, bending at the waist. Your body should be in line with the machine.
4. Slowly pull the bar towards you, squeezing your lats as you contract them. Keep your elbows slightly higher than your hands throughout the movement.
5. Avoid letting your shoulders hunch or round during the exercise.
6. Release the bar to its original position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The front cable pull with a narrow grip targets the lats, working them from a different angle compared to other back exercises.
